review: Every now and then, I crave a burger. And every now and then when I crave a burger, I crave a Red Robin burger, complete with steak fries and a freckled lemonade. We were seated at the small two-seat booths near the kitchen. I never liked these seats but they weren't the worst thing about our experience. We ordered a shake and a freckled lemonade. Our server brought the drinks out but the left us with no straws. It was a few minutes before we saw him to get the straws. We ordered two burgers, one with regular fries and the other with sweet potato fries. One of the burgers was also ordered without tomato. Our burgers came out and the fries were with the wrong burgers. And there was tomato in the burger too! Our server seemed to check on us every time he passed by our booth, which was a lot because we were right next to the kitchen entrance. Our server offered a refill on sweet potato fries. We accepted and he walked off away from the kitchen and to another table. I assumed he needed to check on things before putting in the refill request. I didn't see him pass by for at least five minutes. And when he passed by, he checked on us as if we didn't accept the refill. He offered to bring the bill, while I was still only half way through my burger. He brought it shortly after and said, "No rush." Still eating my burger, we ignored the bill and tried to enjoy what was left of our meal. A minute later, the server returns to ask if he can take the bill. We said no. He returns a minute later and asks again. We said no. He returns another minute later. At this point, I'm just finishing my burger and eating my fries. We said no again. A few minutes later, I'm done with my meal and am ready to pay the bill. I stand it upright (classic sign that the bill is ready). He passes by and picks it up. When the server comes back with the bill to be signed, he leans on our table as if he wants to chat but doesn't say anything. He stutters a bit and then leaves. I don't get it. We left feeling rushed and unsatisfied. In retrospect, my burger was pretty good, but it was the service that made the lasting memory.

Growing up on the west coast as a child, Red Robin use to be one of my favorite restaurants.  I am highly disappointed with the quality of the food and how it has gone down.  Went on Saturday ordered a turkey burger which was still partially frozen, and the meat was a very cheap grade of turkey.  My husband ordered a burger that he complained was horrible.  I will never eat here again, they better step their game up if they want to remain in business.

Ate my lunch here today.  My order was correct and prompt. Good tasting burger but a bit smaller than I remember. Have they reduced the size of the burgers?  Service was good bringing out the food and checking on me but a bit slow on the bill and returning my change. I will return.

If you like burgers and unlimited steak fries, look no further.  Red Robin has become my go to place for a great burger.  The staff is very friendly and our meals have consistently been great.  Good size menu with good pricing.  Great family environment too. Join their Red Royalty club and get a free burger on your birthday as well as other great deals.

I haven't had a problem at this place as the service has always been good when I went. Though I was surprised at the size of the burger which looked very smaller than what they had advertised but it was pretty good. I do like the discounts that they give you every so often if you're registered in their Royalty Club.
This branch was really good when it first opened, but it's sort of gone south from there. It's definitely worth a try, though. I recommend the California chicken burger.

The very first time I ate at a Red Robin was in L.A. - just a few weeks before I moved to Georgia!  My friends told me they couldn't believe I had never been to a Red Robin before.  After that first time, I was immediately a fan. Since then, I've signed up for the free Red Royalty card, which is their version of a frequent buyer card.  All you have to do is ask your server for a card, and then you have to register it online.  They offer cool deals like "Buy 9 Get the 10th Free - Mix and match Fresh & Fire-grilled Burgers, Entrées & Salads."  However, my favorite annual perk is the free burger you get during the month of your birthday!  It's become a tradition to take at least one of my siblings with me each year when I go to get my birthday burger.  =) Most recently, my three siblings and I went to this Red Robin around 3 pm on a Friday for my free birthday burger.  It didn't take me very long to decide which burger I wanted: the A.1.® Peppercorn burger cooked to medium temperature.  I also requested ranch and BBQ sauce to dip my "unlimited" fries in. * A.1.® Peppercorn Burger ($10.39) - Per the menu description, this "gourmet" burger is topped with "hardwood-smoked bacon, melted Pepper-Jack cheese, A.1.® Peppercorn Spread, crispy onion straws and fresh tomatoes on an onion bun."  Doesn't it sound good?  Yuuuum...  The burger patty itself was probably cooked closer to medium-well than medium.  Although it's not even close to as good as my favorite burger in Atlanta (Bocado!), I enjoyed the mixture of the various flavors and liked the onion bun!  The steak fries, which are served with the burgers, are "bottomless" so you can eat to your heart's content.  They aren't the most amazing fries ever, but sprinkle some of their seasoned salt, dip into your favorite sauces, and enjoy with your burger! My brother was such a fan of the fries that he got two refills of them!  They also had no problem providing more fries to take home.  I know most people are probably thinking, "Who takes fries home?!"  Yes, we do.  (*Hint: Toaster ovens are magical!) Overall, this Red Robin deserves 3.5 stars because their burger isn't the greatest, but I'm rounding up to 4 stars for their awesome Red Royalty card and friendly service.  Red Robin's "gourmet" burgers certainly aren't cheap but not expensive, and who else offers "bottomless steak fries"?  I wish there was a Red Robin closer to my house but since this one (almost 20 minutes away) is the closest, it'll have to do.  I'll continue to return to this Red Robin for birthdays (mine and my siblings') and occasions when I feel like pigging out on steak fries with a good burger. [Review 227 of 366]

The first time I visited here was with my sister, Angela H. The second time, also with her as well and she told me to sign up for a royalty rewards card so that on my next visit I'll recieve a free meal on my birthday! So I asked my waiter if I could get one of those royalty rewards card and once I did, I saw a sticker which said I could get a free appetizer within 14 days after I signed up. So I saved it and tried to use it the year after (this year), but they changed their promo and told me that the offer is now invalid. I was disappointed but I know it wasn't the waiter's fault that their policy changed. So here I was with my 3 siblings, we were seated right away in a booth. My sister, Angela H. used her birthday meal coupon and got her free meal and her diet coke.  **Bleu Ribbon burger - $9.99 Basted with a tangy steak sauce and topped with crumbled Bleu cheese.  Served with crispy onion straws, lettuce, fresh tomatoes and zesty chipotle mayo on an onion bun.** I had ordered the Bleu Ribbon burger which had bleu cheese crumbles on top of the beef. I don't remember the french fries being so flat and wide.. hmmm... maybe it's just me.. but I thought the fries were a lot thinner. Anyways, I'm not too big on fries, so I let my siblings chow on those. I had a few but wasn't crazy about the fries. I wasn't too big on the bleu cheese either, but my little brother was and so I ordered it just so that I could half it with him. I don't eat much. Surprisingly, the Bleu Ribbon burger was tasty.. and I think I'd get it, again.

We have made several trips to Red Robin.  Today was without a doubt the best! First the food:  everything was cooked as ordered.  Fries were hot.  Meat was perfect.  Kids meals satisfied the little ones. The service:  we were a party of 18.  They were able to accommodate us all.  The server (Bob) was thorough with suggestions to each order.  Our glasses were never empty and neither were the French Fry baskets! We have had some not so good experiences at Red Robin.  This one makes me forget about all the bad ones!   Go see Bob.  Tell him we sent you!

I recently went back to Red Robin even though several I was less than happy with my previous visits.  Just to clarify, the taste of the food has never been an issue. I went with a group of almost 20 people for lunch on a Sunday and we were seated within 5 minutes of arriving.  I was surprised since the previous visits with a large crowd involved waiting around 30 minutes. The server (Bob) was patient and professional.  He took care of the entire group, making sure drinks were always full and the french fry baskets were not empty.  The meals were brought out in less than 15 minutes and every single order was correct. I don't know if the management has changed recently, but Red Robin got it right in every facet!

So Snellville loses a Fuddruckers and gains a Red Robin.  Not a good trade off in my opinion. The Veggie Patty is pretty good.  I'm also impressed that they offer a 2nd "vegan" option (the Boca Burger, but it is just plain nasty - cardboard on the outside, but mushy on the inside), so I stick with the Veggie patty which has some cheese in it. I like to get the patty wrapped in lettuce in lieu of a bun. The fries are all you can eat steak fries, but I can only take a few.  Too thick, often too soft. Red Robin is more expensive than Fuddruckers was (and there is no "fixins" bar). Most employees are teenagers - most seem uninterested in their job, although we've had a couple really good waiters.  I guess the service is best described as "hit or miss". We eat here occasionally, but our visits usually remind me of how much I miss Fuddruckers (R.I.P.)  Unfortunately, my 11 year old daughter really likes Red Robin, so I'm sure we'll be back more often than I'd choose to eat here myself...

Our Red Robin experience has, unfortunately, been more miss than hit.  We keep coming back because we've got a toddler and we hope to have a sit down meal in a place that's appealing to both him and the parents as well as friends.  Unfortunately the food quality continues to disappoint. On our most recent experience the first bad mark was that the place was HOT.  It's the middle of an afternoon on a Sunday and the manager was refusing to turn on the AC (according to our waiter).  We complained.  She said there was nothing to be done.  We complained again.  She said the manager didn't care.  We said we were leaving.  The manager turned the AC on.  It shouldn't have to go that far.  Admittedly this was in a cool September - but on a day with the highs in the low 80's, a place should have the AC on in Georgia.  It's expected.  Don't be cheap just because it's a Sunday afternoon. Finally - the food comes out: the wrong fries, toppings on the burger were wrong, kid's corn dog was burnt to a crisp, our pretzel appetizer had about half the nuggets compared to the picture, drinks took until the meal was half eaten to deliver ... Unfortunately it was the final straw.  There are too many other options in the suburban chain hell that is Gwinnett to eat at a bad one.

My friends and I went there one Thursday afternoon for lunch as it was not too far from our pool center after our workout. We were seated immediately as it was not too crowded then. Lucky us, I thought. Just wait for the real story to unfold in a minute. Our waiter went around our table of 4 and took our drink orders first. He came back shortly with our drinks but he did not put my hot beverage in a coffee mug. He said one of the other waiters had broken a tray of coffee mugs on Sunday. Excuse me, but it was 4 days ago. Shouldn't the mugs be replaced by now? So I get my hot beverage in a glass which I could not really hold on to drink or gulp. There was only one coffee mug in the entire restaurant which was given to my friend who had ordered hot tea. Then he went ahead and took our individual orders. We shared an appetizer together.  The appetizer of Towering Onion Rings came with tangy campfire sauce and ranch dressing for dipping. We were about to dig into the appetizer but we were missing our silverware. We waved down the waiter to bring us our silverware with napkins. The sweet yellow onion rings were crispy and right out of the fryer. Then comes our lunch entrees. We ordered a Caeser Salad with a bowl of Chicken Tortilla Soup. The salad was good and the chicken vegetable tortilla soup had Cheddar cheese topped with some sour cream and tortilla strips. My friend said it was alright. The other friend has The Royal Red Robin burger. It had bacon, American cheese, lettuce, tomatoes and mayo. Also no complain from my friend. Another ordered the Bleu Ribbon Burger which came with Bleu cheese crumbles, onion straws, lettuce and tomatoes. My friend seemed to enjoy her meal too. Then I had my Sauteed Mushroom Burger which had melted Swiss cheese and a spread of garlic Parmesan spread for that extra Yumm. I enjoyed my burger as well. All the burgers range around $10 or so. We were pleased with what the kitchen staff had made.  Then the waiter came back to check on us and it was like a nightmare on Elm Street that started happening. He started to refill some of the glasses with iced tea. Then he started to pour iced tea on MY head. I thought if I was growing a plant on my head then. For a few minutes, he did not realized what he had done. I started to stand up hoping he could see me and stop pouring tea on me. All my friends were taken back and I tried not to make a scene in the restaurant. I sat back down but the waiter did not apologize. He immediately got embarrassed when I nudged him to stop watering my head with tea. He left and went for some extra napkins to bring to me. Then he said it was his birthday that day and he later came back with a pitcher of water. He told me to pour it on him. What?? Bwahhh! I wasn't going to do that tit for tat thing since I am way beyond my elementary schooling years. He kept asking me to pour water back at him. Then he went back to the kitchen and I was wondering what he was going to bring out next. The manager came out and apologized on behalf of the waiter. Manager asked if there is anything he could do to fix the situation. Immediately my 3 friends said I shouldn't have to pay for a bad experience at RR. I was going to pay for my meal in any case but the manager saw how my friends reacted and took the meal off my tab. The manager thought it was just water that the waiter poured on me but I told him it was sweet iced tea. I am a sweet person and I do not need any sweet tea, not on my head. Do you dig this, Mr. Manager? No coffee mug, no silverware, no ketchup for my friend and please stop pouring iced tea on your customer.  That was not quite the lunch I had anticipated from RR, coming from the birthday waiter guy. It was early in the afternoon and certainly too early for happy hours to begin. I kept drying my hair so no lettuces or tomatoes will grow from the tea pouring experience. Damn, I had never given a 2 stars to any restaurant. This will go down in history as one of my weirdest dining experience. I'm not saying I won't come back, maybe next time with a better wait staff to sweep me off my feet so I can forget this one. Yelp 27/365

we were on our way to wild wing cafe-45 min wait for 2 people, I dont think so, so we went to Red Robin, seated in 7 mins, waitress was great and also the head waitress came over, concerned, we were just people watching, no problem. food was great, serivce great, not enough TV's, other than that

All this whining. My God ,it is a burger joint. I would put thier steak fries ,sweet potato fries, onion rings, and burgers up against anybody's in the burger buisness. No one has mentioned the drinks from the bar...excellent bartenders.Dear god I could go on and on but I will not do so.Go see for yourself,you might like it. Quit the crying.

The feel of the restraint was nice. The burger i got was lacking flavor. The drinks were good. I would try it again. The service was good. Always checking on you for refills. And they offer one to take with you

We went here for Father's day this past weekend.  Place was packed but we had reservations and were seated promptly. We had a new server (Amanda) who was being trained by another employee.  I am not sure why on earth management decided to put a new person on a table of 15.  She was clearly overwhelmed. Granted the place was full but 15-20 minutes to get drinks was unacceptable. Also, the food was slow in coming out.  My hamburger had a sweet flavor I did not like which maybe was  due to their relish. Portions were scanty in terms of my daughter's chicken nuggets as well as their "bottomless fries." I had to order a refill of fries and when I saw the 4-5 fries on the basket I pointed out why so little to the waitress and she said the kitchen could only send out 3 ounces of fries at a time. Then the manager came by the table and he offered us (2) free dessert/appetizer coupons with the purchase of a dinner for next visit.  Uh no thanks, I don't think I will be coming back here. Though drink prices were reasonable and fries tasted good,  I have had much better experiences and food at Hardee's close to my house.

sigh.... you had me at free refills of root-beer floats. Food is just ok the bar is pretty nice if you don't mind getting blasted while 2 year olds wale in the background. As my family grows these places just become PTPTK Places, to, please, the, kids

The food was just mediocre, my husbands burger was raw and if we had had any sort of decent service we would of ordered another one, but the kids and I were done with our meals before he came back around again. Luckily getting the burger taken off was no problem, even the manager came and apologized. We should of taken a hint when it took us 20 min to even get noticed. When he did he said oh yeah we are out of clean silverware but I promise when we get some I will bring it with your meal. Which of course didn't happen. After he took our order he came back 20 min later and said oh yeah the kitchen is running behind do you want to order an appetizer - when we said no he was like ok I will put your order in now. WTH? So a 2 hour dining experience with a 5 and a 9 year old at a 2:00 on a sat when you just want a quick bite to eat did not sit well with us. I will definitely not be back to this location. Seems they don't have it together here. We noticed we were not the only table looking around and wondering where our server was or food or even silverware,

The burgers and fries are very good, but the service is so slow it ruins the outing. First we were told the wait was 15 minutes. 35 minutes later we were seated. Not good, but that happens. Understand we were a party of two. Then the fun part. Five minutes before a waiter came. We were smart enough to order food and drinks, but it did not matter. Forty minutes later, here comes the food. We both ordered unsweet tea. The refills were, you guessed it, sweet.  All told we were at our table for 1 hour, 15 minutes. This is not likely their business model for a party of two.

I've always seen the commercials but never been to one. -hums the melody- "Reeeed Robinnn, hummmmm..." So I went with a few friends who lives in the area for a catch up. It was packed when we arrived, but host/staff was swift to seat us within 15-20 minute wait for a table of 4.  We all started off by sharing the Onion Rings short stack, which came with a ranch  dressing and another dip that I personally didn't like so I don't recall the name. We all ordered burgers since they're known for their gourmet burgers. I ordered the Grilled Turkey burger with bottomless fries. Burgers were okay. I felt like the burgers were sitting there for awhile because the buns were soggy by the time it reached out table. Overall, food was just lacking flavor.  SERVICE was horrendous. Management needs to address this to the staff or hire better workers. Yes, you're friendly and smiling and letting us know to ask for whatever is needed, but please live up to it.  You don't bring an appetizer out and slap it on the table and expect your customers to dine without utensils or napkins. We asked twice before receiving it. Our water was not once refilled during our 2 1/2 hours there. Very sluggish service even when the restaurant was clearing out.

Nothing gourmet about this place.  Frozen burger patties, extremely loud environment, and anyplace that does the loud train across the restaurant for birthdays does not get my repeat business.  If you want good burgers, Ted's is in the same shopping center.

Service saved this one -- burgers were good but not outstanding, and the dinner theater (we sat next to the kitchen) was pretty entertaining as we watched the food come and go. The onion rings, as other yelper's pictures attest, are outrageous, and their chocolate pie is just as ridiculous!  But the server we had, a man, was awesome. He was incredibly engaging, reaching out to us several times during the meal, chatting with us while we waited on the food, and first and foremost being honest with us when we sat down that due to how busy the restaurant was the food was going to take 20+ minutes to arrive. I can't tell you how much I appreciate honesty in a server -- if it's going to be a wait, I'll do a lot better if you tell me upfront, rather then giving out platitudes.

Unhealthy Food Lovers Unite!!! When I feel like emotionally eating my problems away, I come here!!  Unlimited Steak Fries?! Garlic Steak Fries?! Fried Onion rings?! Fried Mushrooms?! Fried Jalapenos Rings?! Fried Zucchini Sticks?! Fried Cheese Sticks?!!! Yes! Yes! Yes!  Granted, I might be on my way to an early death, but I'm oh-so-happy doing it! I don't come here often (see list of fried goodies), but I love it. Now the veggie options for the burgers are simply "okay". I never liked BOCA meat (Moringstar is the way to go!) BUT with enough toppings and condiments, I can handle it with a smile. The BOCA "meat" is thick (like maybe an inch or two) & pale & bland. The garden burger is very thin, and composed of various different things (ie. rice, olives, etc). But I usually do the same thing I do with the BOCA meat, I load it with veggies & condiments. Not too bad. I like that you can make any burger, a veggie burger. Fish & Chips: The cod fish is bland. I added some lemon & salt to it. The atmosphere is always fun & loud. The employees have always been very kind to me & co. & the restaurant is clean. Now price is kinda steep when you think about it (especially if you add an appetizer or two or three or....). Combos range from $9-$16. Appetizers range from $3-$9. I guess others don't share my love for all things fried. Red Robins I give you a solid 4 stars! (Switch out your BOCA for Moringstar & it will be a solid 5) I think I might be scheduled for my usual emotional meltdown in a few days, Red Robins here I come!!

I visited this location this past weekend for lunch. I usually order the burnin love burger but decided to try something different. I went for the prime chophouse burger. The prime chophouse burger is layered with horseradish-sautéed mushrooms, steak sauce, provolone cheese, country dijon mustard and crispy onion straws. Since I'm not a huge fan of steak sauce, I asked for it on the side. My husband had the guacamole bacon burger.  For dessert I had the pumpkin spice shake. Everything was delicious! The pumpkin shake totally satisfied my pumpkin craving and the burgers were cooked well. Service was good. I'll be back.
Went on a slow night so service was good as to be expected. Food was good. Loved the onion rings.

Had dinner with my wife on a weekend evening.  Got there early, or so we thought, but we still had to wait a few minutes for a table even though there were scattered empty tables for two all over the restaurant.  But we waited anyway and were seated. Service was mediocre at best.  I ordered a cheeseburger cooked well done.  It took about 20-25 minutes to get it, and it was cooked medium (at best), probably closer to medium rare.  Rather than complain and wait for a replacement, I did eat most of it.   You can tell the place is not particularly well run.  The staff appears to be "lost" and organization appears to be very lacking.  And on top of that, it is not terribly clean.  It's not the worst place I've ever been, but not worth a return trip.  If you want a burger, you're better off just sticking with McDonald's, Wendy's,  .....

I had absolutely no intentions of writing a review for Red Robin, but my last visit makes me want to properly thank them. MY FIRST VISIT MANY YEARS AGO We used to come to this location weekly when it first opened, long before my unpaid career on yelp began (LOL)! I'll never forget the server recommending their Royal Red Robin burger. She said I needed to try it and listed all the ingredients. But the one ingredient that caught my attention was the fried egg on top. "Say whaaa? A fried egg on a burger? I'll pass!" I said. "Try it. If you don't like it I will take it back and you can have whatever you want on the house." She confidently proclaimed. Well, with odds like that who wouldn't accept the challenge. The moment came when the burger arrived and the manager delivers the burger herself. All eyes on me as I took my first bite with a twisted 'I don't want to eat this' look on my face (I can be very expressive). "Well?" She asked "Gimme a minute, gimme a minute" I said as I tried to savor the new flavor combo going on in my mouth. "I hate to tell you this since you were so confident I would like it... but I don't!"  That look of defeat came over their faces and I couldn't tease them anymore... "I LOVED it" I joyfully exclaimed, causing her to do a pelvic thrust of victory! LOL Over the next 6 months we were loyal customers, but what started off as a beautiful relationship began to go sour. The food just started to taste different and not in a good way. We stopped coming and Red Robin fell off our radar.  MY MOST RECENT EXPERIENCE Fast forward about 6 years and we find ourselves in the area after a wrestling match @ Brookwood High School, so we decided to give them another try. It was a Saturday afternoon and the dining room was half full. The other half was full of tables that had yet to be cleaned and it stayed that way for the first half of our visit. The floors had visible debris and I was totally amazed at how the girl sweeping missed most of it as she swept. Seriously? You don't see that? I thought to myself.  Our silverware comes and it too was dirty with dried on gook and I was honestly ready to leave. But, we stayed since we weren't going to be using the silverware anyway. I just wasn't in the mood for a burger so I decided to order the Crispy Chicken sandwich. All the while I sat there I was annoyed with the conditions of the store, but slowly they started to get it together (I think they were in the middle of a shift change). By the time our food arrived most of the tables were clean, but the floor could still use some help.  FOOD/SERVICE I'm telling you, the crispy chicken sandwich was so good it completely turned my mood around. It hit the spot so perfectly I made a second trip for lunch two weeks later. The sandwich was just as amazing, but what I want to share is the story of service on that 2nd visit. I was greeted with a warm smile from the hostess as she opened the front doors for me. I was then directed to the bar for my take out order where a server and the bartender both took my order. While I was waiting, Don (the manager) greeted me and he, the bartender and I began chatting about food. I talked about how my go-to dish used to be their shrimp platter, which prompted him to ask if I'd ever tried the clams. I told him I love clams but they literally hurt my jaws to eat. He goes off to answer a phone call and the bartender and I continue our conversation. A few moments later he brings out an order of clams just for me. He insisted I try them and boy was I happy I did. They were DE-LI-CIOUS and very tender.  The waitress returns with my lunch and included a Coke in a to-go cup. She then cozies up with the rest of us as we talked. As I prepare to leave, she gives me a gentle rub across my back and warmly tells me to come back while the bartender and manager are Googling directions to a restaurant they recommend I try in Watkinsville. They were so unusually friendly I started to wonder if I was on some sort of hidden TV show. They practically walked me to my car and I gotta say I found myself thinking about how well they treated me for the rest of my day. THE VERDICT I have no idea what I did to deserve such kindness, but thank you! I am reinstating myself as a fan and placing Red Robin back in my rotation of favorite places to eat! Oh, and FYI - the restaurant was spotless on my 2nd most recent visit.

This place is gross!!! My family and I went last night and the floors were nasty. I had to ask them to clean up. I requested the manager and he/she never showed up to our table.  Our food came out 45 minutes later and it was room temperature. Please see the manager if the place is dirty before you sit down!!! The only good thing was our server  "Bob". He was the greatest!!!

I have been to this location several times. The food is good - especially the burgers and fries. I wasn't too impressed with the club sandwich though. The service is consistently slow. Last time we went, it took so long to get our food that it ended up getting comped (over an hour). I do appreciate that the staff wanted to make it right, but they obviously need either additional staff or additional training. The place has good potential but needs some work.

I went Red Robins last night for the second time in the year.  I waited an hour or more for my order.  The cocktails were weak and the waiter never came to check on us unless we flagged him down.   I wonder if they cook their burgers by slow cooker.

I've been to this Red Robin 3 times, I love the burgers but their fries are hit or miss. When there good there really good but twice they were overcooked and hard. The prime rib sandwich made me wish I ordered a hamburger which is what I usually get.

It's way over crowded and took forever to get our food. I had to ask for every refill though my glass had been sitting empty for 15 min or more. Had to ask for silver wear and napkins even though I ordered a knife and fork burger. All the waitresses seem to have a bad attitude. And the poor bartender looks overwhelmed. Oh and my burger was way way way over cooked! ***About a week after I posted this the manager called and apologized for poor service and sent me a gift card inviting me back. I really do appreciate that they are trying to improve. ****

I was craving burgers and their freckled lemonade....but I'm so sorry to say I will NOT BE COMING BACK. The service was the worst I have ever had in my life. Our server Yasmine forgot what I told her 1 min ago after I  repeated it like 10 times and still didn't get it right wasn't attentive to any of her tables and had other servers do her job for her. Food was okay but the service just ruined it for me!!!!

The fries were cold, the beer was warm, the burger was the smallest I've ever gotten from a Red Robin, and the manager was a creep to my wife when I left to use the restroom. Will NEVER return to this location, even if it were free... We were told 5 times that our reload on the "endless" fries were coming out... 20 minutes, never came.... Told we'd get them to-go... Waited 10 more minutes... Never came

Service was a bit lacking this visit...we watched several tables wait an extremely long time.  The food quality seems to be slipping too. Our server, Guy, was super friendly and tried to make the visit worth the wait.

So disappointed !!!! Waited over 45mins for two burgers !!! When they finally came one wAs (pink) ordered well done .. The manager came over and apologized and recooked another burger ... however did nothing to compensate for our long wait and raw burger!  Can't stand that I just wasted $40 On a poorly made meal ...

Food is great. Service sucks. Been here in multiple occasions and the servers always blame the bar when you are waiting 20 minutes for a drink or shake. Burgers are always great. I recommend the burnin' love. This place would be so much better if the service is better. However, the managers are always on the floor helping out and fixing problems.

We were a bit put off by the reviews but decided to give Red Robin a try and we sure are glad we did! Our waiter Robert (Bob) was awesome and super helpful. My husband asked for a few recommendations and he told us his personal favorites and popular items and told us about a seasonal shake. My husband got the Chili Cheese burger and I got a bowl of Red's Chili Chili and we both were super satisfied! My husband said his burger was seasoned and cooked perfectly and the chili and cheese was an awesome topper. My bowl of chili came with a great little focaccia bread to dip that was really tasty and the chili was awesome! I hardly order a bowl of chili out and I'm glad I did it here. Our waiter hooked us up with a Red Robin card and we will definitely be back to try more!

A couple of days after letting Red Robin corporate of my experience, I was contacted by Sean the manager of this location and he apologized for the poor service and promised to make it right. He offered me a couple of free burgers for me to return and I took him up on that offer this past weekend. This time the service was much better, the waiter (Robert) was much more attentive and even though the restaurant was more crowded than it was during our first visit the service was much quicker.  Refills on the fries did not take 15 minutes, in fact it was almost immediate.   Robert would frequently check up on us and made sure we had everything we needed and that our drinks were full without us having to ask.  Basically, completely opposite of my first experience here. I really appreciate that Sean contacted me about my poor experience and wanted to make it right.  As a result I will return here in the future. As I stated in my original review, this location is far from my home, but if I'm in the area and want a good burger, then this will be my first choice.
We ate here for the first time this week.  Food was good.  A few items on the menu seemed a little pricey, but the burger and unlimited fries was good value.  More like a 4.5star.

Where to start, we waited 5 minutes to be seated then told "your server will be right with you" so we waited and noticed no one near us to take our order and 3 other tables empty. We could see others seated after were served and eating. After 22 minutes I went to the hostess to ask if anyone was going to take our order or get drinks and the response was " that is xxxx's table and we can not find her" ???? So I asked why we were seated at a table with no server, no response (we should have left then) we stayed and someone came after another 5 minutes, then 15 more for the food and we were promised a manager would stop by and "was aware of our issue" but no one came. A total time of 90 minutes for 3 burgers. We paid and left, then completed an online survey with a call request and.... you guessed it, no one ever called. We refuse to return and only waited as it was our daughters birthday and she wanted to eat there.... a lack of service, accountability and follow up sums up this review.

Let me just say the food is redeeming factor. We were seated quickly and the service went downhill from there. After a long wait at the table without a greeting, the server showed up unapologetically and asked if we were ready to order yet. Yet. Sigh.  Our table remained largely neglected during our visit. Empty glasses and plates sat at the table. He made brief fly by check in's  where he seemed uninterested in hearing what each person needed. Or listening to half the people at the table...  of two.   The food was decent though I returned the raspberry lemonade because it was awful. This visit was defined by the very poor service. Not sure I would return any time soon.
My family loves red robin ! ( so do I ) I really enjoy the endless fries, salad, or fruits ! Their monster milkshake is yummy as well! I just wish the service was a little better

...the customer service at this spot is TOP NOTCH! This is my second time frequenting this spot. I didn't realize that I had a $20 royalty discount that had expired back in December. Sean, the manager for the night, honored my unknowningness! This was far and beyond what I had expected and says a lot about their customer service. I'm eyeing a letter of gratitude to their corporate office and complimenting Sean & our waitress, Christy. The visit was totally worthwhile because of them. I ate the Whiskey Bourbon BBQ burger and was full after the 1st half of my sandwich. Starting my 21 day fast tomorrow and couldn't think of another place to get my last bite of red meat. #bonappetite

I like a restaurant that I can visit with my kids as much as one that I can visit without them. And this one falls under the with the kids category. Our family has made many trips on Friday nights to Red Robin without many issues. And in the instance of an issue, it is resolved before we get up from the table without us having to ask for the manager. The food is good for burgers and fries and I like the variety on the menu (not too much but not just a few). The service is what makes them a little better to me. My young kids are always entertained not only by our server but by passing servers. If you are in the mood for a burger and fries (or their onion tower) make a stop and you should not be disappointed. Also, you can hang out in the bar area if you don't want to be bothered with kids through the restaurant. The bar area is for adults only.

It's a burger place. Their claim to fame is they are a "gourmet" burger establishment but really it's just a burger. I've had better but I've also had worse.  He service was okay. He was friendly but the service was slow. Waited 20 minutes for my milkshake and over 40 minutes total for our food. An additional 15 for our dessert. Luckily the Seattle vs. Greenbay game was on so we had entertainment and free French fries to snack on. Otherwise I would have been mad.  I ordered a turkey burger but ended up with a chicken sandwich. My dad's burger came out exactly as he ordered it and he said it was "very tasty indeed" Slow service seems to be a recurring theme based on previous reviews. Just be prepared to wait a while for your food but hopefully it will be tasty once you get it.

This review is for 2 visits, on our first visit the service was great but the fried food all came out over done also I ordered and sent back my onion rings because they tasted like they had been cooked in old grease.  Now we go to the 2nd visit. Let me start by saying that mine and my wife's burger was perfect, my daughter did not like the patty melt and they replaced it with another burger, so we are happy there. The problem tonight was the service, our waitress was wearing a cooks shirt and the wait staff all had sour looks on their faces so I am guessing they were understaffed. I am not going to use our waitresses name because she tried very hard and she made my youngest daughter feel very important with how she treated her, I think she was just not doing the job she was trained for. She would forget to check on us and keep our drinks filled, multiple times she forgot what we asked for. So overall the service was pretty poor, I want to stress that she was trying though. This review may be a little harsh but I think the  management needs to get some control over staffing in order to give better service. That said, I thought the burgers were good and we will return again.

Visited Red Robin tonight 2/23 with my Mom. We were immediately disgusted when we walked in the door as the hostesses were eating at the front table (where customers could have been sat) with a less than appetizing view. Food was sprawled over the entire table and spilling onto the floor. We tried to overlook the initial disgusting state of the restaurant and followed the hostess to the back of the restaurant where she attempted to sit us at a table that obviously had not been looked under. The floor under the table was entirely soaked (like a drink or two were spilt and not cleaned up). There were also food droppings all under the table. We asked to be sat at 2 tables over (the only clean table we could spot). Keep in mind for later that this table was in direct view of the kitchen. Though we were taken back and surprised (because we have been customers of this restaurant since it opened) our server was VERY polite. She addressed us almost immediately after we sat down and seemed MUCH cleaner than the restaurant itself...she almost seemed out of place (sad).  After placing our order, we had some time to sit and talk. While waiting, we could see into the kitchen (like I said before). I took a double take when one of the food preparation employees turned around (WITH A FULL PLATE OF FOOD IN HER HANDS) and sneezed-seemingly onto the food in her hands. Whether or not she tried to miss the food I am unsure. I was in denial...there was no way she just sneezed on a plate of food coming out of the kitchen. As I continued to watch, the same employee continued to wipe her nose all over her shirt (like a child).  At this point we had enough. We asked to pay for our drinks and for our food order to be cancelled. We also asked to speak to the manager. She came over and let us know she would take care of our food order. No real apology was delivered from the front of the house manager. The kitchen manager then came out to apologize. We explained that the kitchen was not the only reason we were disgusted but it was definitely the final straw. She made us aware that she would address the issue with this specific employee. She also wanted to make sure this would not be our last visit (sadly it probably will be).  As we were walking out the front door (and past the kitchen) we heard a fake "ahh-choo" coming from the kitchen. As if we had not already had enough reason to leave.  Good luck staying healthy if you decide to visit Red Robin on 124 in Snellville at the former Avenue (now the shoppes).
I had a wonderful first time experience here! The food and the service were both excellent. The restroom was immaculately clean and that's a pet peeve of mine! I'll definitely be back!

I wish I could give half a star. I have never written reviews for a restaurant before but the service here is awful so I have to warn other Red Robin Lovers. I am appalled by the way they treated us. I do not want to throw the racist card here but trust me I think this place is like that. I only found this out later after reading another review. I am Asian by the way. We ordered a gourmet burger and they substituted the bun without asking us and brought the burger out. When we asked about the bun, they told us it was over. I am surprised that the waitress did not feel the need to come and inform us about the bun and ask us whether we wanted to change the order or not before the order came. We did not want to change the order after the burger came and wait all the remaining of us had burgers. When we called the manager, he only offered to give us $1 off a $60 bill ! They should have taken the whole burger off or at least a drink for their mistake but then again I think it may be because of our race. I do not want to call out the name of the manager but I thought he was really unprofessional. Please never come to this Red Robin.

The service wasn't the best. We had to wait a long while to get someone to take our drink orders, and than a bit longer to get all our drinks. After that, we had the person who was suppose to be our server take our food order.  The food didn't take that long to come out. I ordered the Teriyaki Chicken with a side of 'Freckled Fruit". The chicken sandwich was very good, but the fruit was weird. It was fruit in some kind of fruit juice or syrup, and the strawberries looked like the ones you would use to make a processed smoothie drink, like they'd been soaking in the same jar as the maraschino cherries. But the apples were fresh, and I think it also had canned pineapple chunks in it. Nonetheless, I didn't eat it, it was unappetizing.  It took forever to get our bill. We had to finally ask the hostess to get it for us. I'm happy we got there when we did, because by the time we left the whole front lobby was swarmed with people waiting to get seated.
Love that they give a free Birthday Burger!  Looks like I will be cashing in soon! Good drinks and friendly staff.
This was my first time here at this location and only second time in life..the food was really good especially the garlic seasoned fries...lost a star because the service was meh

Great burger joint and nice endless steak fries with over 10 different sauces to choose from! Not a bad place to spend an afternoon. Sign up for their loyalty program to receive a free birthday burger during your birthday month!

It's been 5 months and every time I drive pass this place I shake my head in shame it's my name Robin but I wouldn't feed a homeless person this crap on a bun and takes 40 minutes to get an alcoholic beverage

The worst Red Robin I have ever been to. The waiters, and managers are completely rude. We had to wait a very long time for our server to even come to our table, and finally a manager came to take our order instead. She was so unfriendly and rude, we ended up leaving...even after we had waited 30 min. to get a table. I'd rather drive to another location. Definitely never going back to this one.

Came in on a very busy Sunday afternoon. It took a while to be seated but was not excessive. Our waiter was first rate......took our order very quickly.....was very attentive. The hamburgers tasted good......but were not cooked exactly to order. We ordered medium well and they came to us cooked medium. Also were barely warm. Not the end of the world.  Cole slaw was good.

We visited this location on Saturday, June 13th at about 4:30. Surprisingly, the waiting area was full, yet there were several tables open but in need of cleaning. They were either short of staff, or they were moving at a snail's pace. We opted to sit in the bar area rather than to wait to sit in the dining area. We entered the area to find that it was not clean. There were dishes and food on and behind the bar. In fact, we had to wait for someone to come wipe out our seats before we could sit down. Once we sat, I discovered that the floor was sticky. All of this distracted from the experience. I'm not sure exactly how long it took for us to receive the food, but it was not worth the wait. For the price, we were definitely expecting better. Due to the wait, we didn't even bother to order more fries. The aspect of the visit that bothered me the most was how the bartenders "cleaned" the blender pitchers. Apparently, after a blender is used, its pitcher is placed in the sink under running water, which is allowed to run continuously. After another pitcher is used and in need of "cleaning," the "clean" pitcher in the sink is dumped of its water and replaced with the dirty pitcher, water still running continuously. We sat at the bar for at least an hour and 15 minutes and never once was the water turned off. Due to their wastefulness, uncleanness & mediocre food, I will not be visiting this location again any time soon. I really don't understand why it is so popular.
Definitely go for lunch service is great, refill are on time and your food is cooked properly.  Staff is friendly and helpful Emily our waitress wad stupendous.

I had wrote this place off after the sucky service last month. We were in the area and my wife wanted to try it so, I'm ashamed to admit it but, I gave RR one more chance. We had the two kids. We all ordered different side dishes but all were served fries (one of us actually ordered fries). Wife's side finally arrived well after she had finished her meal. Sauce for the appetizer was less than half full and appeared to be used. Sent it back and we could actually hear the servers accusing us of trying to rip them off for a 75 cent container of dip! At the end, needed a to-go cup for my 4-year old's shake. Waitress never came so we left. No servers to serve us but you better believe 3 of them came charging us when they saw us leaving with their cheap plastic cup! Needless to say, the wife is now in agreement that we will never go near this place again.

Whenever I'm looking for a burger with something different, this is where I go. Never had a bad experience. My favorite is the Smoke and Pepper Burger. The peppered ketchup is great and I don't even like ketchup lol. Only gave it four stars because I've had better burgers, but don't get me wrong, Red Robin's burgers as good as well. Will definitely return!

Our burgers were great!  I was expecting this place to be terrible because of some bad feedback I've gotten but to the contrary we enjoyed our visit and food.  The waitress wasn't the friendliest but I can't judge that because maybe she was just having a bad day.

Waited over 40 minutes for food. It was a Friday night but still way too long. All 3 of us had something wrong with our orders... Not one was correct. Mine in particular was for cheese fries that arrived plain- when finally got corrected order we had already finished eating- no apologies forthcoming.
Great food poor service...our server was the bartender and was the only one working everyone else was just standing around

So this is the first time I have been to this red robin since I started doing Yelp Reviews.  For some reason, the older folks in my family love this place but every time they go, they complain A LOT.  So I usually skip the family outing.  I ask them why they continue to go back... Its like supporting a bad habit.  Anyway... They wanted to go tonight and I have been out of town a lot lately and haven't seen them too much so I decided to go with them.  We went as a party of 5.  I was pleasantly surprised at the remodel that was done at this location.  At first glance it looked clean, smelled fresh and new.  It is very dark though.  Actually hard to see your menus and food.  We asked them to turn up the lights but it was never done.  The new dining room is very crowded.  The chairs actually but up against chairs from other tables.  Once you are seated don't plan on getting up to go anywhere.  My grandmother went to the restroom and came out complaining.  She said they were out of toilet paper, the counters were sloppy with water and soap all over it.   Our server initially seemed attentive. She came to see us right away and took our drink orders. When she arrived back, 2 of the 5 drinks were wrong.  She had to pass the drinks around the table because she couldn't walk in between the tables due to a tight squeeze.  For appetizers, MIL ordered onion rings and I ordered French onion soup cooked well done.. cheese dark on top.  A few minutes later the onion rings showed up and they were perfect. No problems.  About 10 minutes later my soup rolled out.. it was not cooked well at all and the cheese on top was not cooked enough.  No spoon either ... hard to eat soup with a fork.  When she finally came back with a spoon our meal was coming out.  So my appetizer was the same time my meal. UGH Frustrating.  We had an assortment of burgers between 3 people. None of which had any complaints about the burgers and said they tasted good.   My grandfather ordered clam chowder as his meal... It did not come out with the rest of our meal.  It took an additional 10 minutes to get his Chowder and the reason was .. NO BOWLS !   There were only 3 tables occupied in the restaurant and no bowls.   The waitress said they had a busy lunch so they needed to wash bowls.  This is now 5:30 in the afternoon and they haven't done dishes since lunch.  Gramps did say that the chowder was good once he got it.  I ordered "Clucks" with broccoli. ( chicken fingers ) The chicken fingers were WAY over-cooked.  They were very crispy and seemed like there was more breading than chicken.  The broccoli was cooked well and tasted fine.  At this point I was so frustrated with everything else that was going on so I just kept the clucks and took them home to the dogs.  All in all .. it took us an hour and a half to eat at a Red Robin ???? Not a good experience.  Not once did a manager offer to make anything right.  I will remind my family once again why we should not visit this place again ....  Buyer beware .....

My sons and I visited Red Robin once again. We come here at least once a month.They have updated the interior and exterior of the restaurant since the last time that we were here. I love all the new updates. Now it is divided off into a bar area and restaurant. The food was good as usual and the service was excellent (Thanks Ryan!!).

Place had awful service, which is not becoming of the actual chain. We sat waiting on service on our table for 15 minutes without anyone taking our drink orders. Thoroughly disappointed with this place, will definitely write management regarding my experience.

If I could give this place less stars I would. This is the third time I have come to this establishment with friends. This place seems to be severely lacking in server training. I understanding being busy, I served for 8 years. This was just unattentive laziness. Our drinks were never refilled, our servers switched without asking or explaining, the food was okay but took forever to get, we waved our server down multiple times and he just walked away. We eventually had to grab another server who made an honest effort to help us. We were there almost 2 hours! 50% of which was waiting on our food or a server. I'll never be back. Neither will anyone else in my group
Great food, always worth the trip. Service could step it up a little bit in the sense of disappearing servers.

Love red robins!! I am an absolute French fries addict! The atmosphere was great. The manager actually went around and ask about the service and food. He was a very polite. They brought us a sample plate of all their infamous fries dips and oh my gosh heaven!! The burgers are outstanding and the beer pretzel dip is bomb! I will for sure come back again!!

Last night I had friends in town.   We typically eat at great food quality restaurants.  A few weeks ago my partner and I brought his mother here.  We had great food and great service.   What a difference a week makes.   It's important to know who is running the show here when you decide to come in.   The food was still good however the restaurant was trashed and looked like a dump!  I thought I had walked into an episode of hoarders!  We were sat in an area where 10 tables were trashed and were never cleaned during mournfully visit.     The first time I got my military discount and this time the server couldn't figure out how to get that to me and stated well I guess you don't get it this time.   Then on our way out I noticed everyone on staff was more worried about cleaning and breaking down the bacon of the house versus keeping up the front of the house.   Just amazing.  So disappointed and not sure I could come back after this experience.   I need a clean environment when eating my dinner.

Service can be a hit or miss, food is normally pretty good and we'll made. Red Robin asks it's customers to refrain from us to be able to defend ourselves and our families via firearms. Idea is disturbing to know we're all sitting ducks in a crowded place like this.

Horrible, even their water was bad. They got my order wrong, gave me a practically uncooked burger, super greasy. Corrected it but still didn't get it right. Their tavern sauce is thousand island dressing. Just the whole meal was awful, slow service too. I'll never go back.

We arrived at 11 when they first opened. Took a bit to get seated and they had plenty of employees standing around. We ordered and food took forever to come out. Every table was complaining about the wait. No manager even came up to our table to check on us. Went to the bathroom... No toilet paper and no soap. How does that happen when the restaurant just opened??? This has to fall on management. Oh and bottomless fries... They ran out and we were told it'll take awhile to come out. Probably won't be back. Shame Bc the food is pretty good!

Negative 5 stars! We had a party of 5 on a Saturday night. Hostess told us that it would be an hour wait. Ok, we understand. Busy Saturday night. No biggie until every damn party that walked in after us got seated before us. Honestly, I don't think the hostess knew wtf she was doing. So we asked her a few times how much longer and she kept saying they had to get a bigger table..... BULLSHIT!!! From the waiting area, we could clearly see that there was a big table for 6 empty for about 30 minutes. Funny enough, that was the damn table they seated us at. Ok so maybe the hostess sucked ass but maybe the food and service would be better. Nope, not the case! We waited about 10 minutes until a server came and took our order. She disappeared after that. Never came back and checked on us or told us how much longer for the food. We waited forever! The table next to us, that sat down 20 minutes AFTER we did, got their food BEFORE we did. Seriously, WTF!!!!! One dish came out 30 minutes before the rest. (This is already 45 minutes in) Wow... Just wow. So finally the rest of the food came out. Fries were cold. Soup came out late as hell. By this time, it's already 10pm. I am so over it at this point... This location is such a poorly staffed/poorly managed establishment! We're never coming back to this dump! Tonight was just horrible! Save yourselves the money and time! This location is definitely not worth it!
Horrible service! Waited 25 minutes and never got drinks. I told the manger as we were walking out and he could care less.

So someone from Red Robin saw my review and sent me a message saying someone would contact me...I'm really disappointed.. Noone contacted me...instead someone sent a $20 gift card...as a way to say what exactly. We are are family of 5 and our bill was approximately $67...2 16oz. Blue Moon's, Jump Starter Double (burnt dry fries), 2 Banzai Meals, 2 kids meals (meatball lollipops for my daughter didn't come until almost 20 minutes after the 2 banzai and her brothers pizza and when it came, they forgot the sauce) I finally ordered a royal so my daughter and I could eat.  Our server was rude and unapologetic...the floors and ladies bathroom was disgusting.  The $20 gift card was an insult.  Our dinner was ruined, we paid $67 and the manager never came out to apologize....Poor Customer Service at its finest.

The other half and I ventured out on a rainy night because I had a taste for Red Robin.  I was really sold because they were advertising the $15 deal (an appetizer or dessert and 2 Tavern Burgers). We were seated immediately and Emily was very attentive from the moment we sat down.  We ordered "Not your father's root beer" since we have been wanting to try it.  She brought our drinks out really quickly.  We decided to upsize the order of boneless wings with buzz sauce for the appetizer.  They were very good but I fear if we would've ordered a half portion we would've only received 4-5 pieces of chicken.  They're served with homemade potato chips which actually complimented the buzz sauce and bleu cheese. Our burgers were up by time we finished the wings.  I had the fiery ghost burger minus the fresh jalapenos and my husband had the burger with shredded pork.  My burger was seasoned well and tasted great.  The spice wasn't too overpowering.  He says he enjoyed his burger as well and you can't go wrong with the bottomless fries. Emily offered us dessert which we declined and she also ensured we were familiar with using the kiosk to complete a self check out.  Also, she mentioned signing up for Red Robin rewards and made sure once I signed up so she could apply this visit. The only negative is I noticed after I had finished almost half of my beer that my glass wasn't clean.  It had someone else's lipstick prints on it. :-/ However outside of this issue, we were in and out of the restaurant in 45 minutes.  Who could beat them for a restaurant experience.  We look forward to returning but next time I think I may ask for a to go cup for my beverage.
Over priced frozen patties.. Not worth the price . You will be better off going to MC D or Burger King

We have only eaten at Red Robin a handful of times but, each time is worse than the last. We only went this time because our daughter chose it for her birthday dinner. The food is not very good, it is VERY overpriced, and the service is way too slow! While our server was friendly, which is nice, it took way too long to get the items we requested and drinks were not being refilled the way they should have been. The kitchen staff looked they were more worried about goofing around than getting food out. And one of the staff at the line rubbed his fingers across his nose, looked at whatever was on said finger, wiped it on his pants and then proceeded to grab a fork, by the prongs, and set it on a plate to go out. And no, he did not wash his hands.  Never again. ****Next morning: To top it off, my husband was sick all night from his food. I repeat, NEVER AGAIN!

They advertise for a tavern deal 2 burgers with fries and an appetizer for 15.99, great deal.  You have to make sure they apply the deal to your check. Then they have a Ziosak at the table, you can order from, and you pay from this.  They have a little trivia thing on it. It didn't say that they charge you for the trivia. 1.99 entertainment fee was added to the check. Beware of the extra charges on the bill.  The food was tasty and hot. The server was ok. We had the ask for napkins and our refills.

Went to Red Robin on Saturday, March 5, 2016.  Asked to sit in the bar to avoid waiting; big mistake.  One waitress came to the table, introduced herself as our waitress.  Ordered root beer and water with lemon slices.  Got the root beer and water only.  Waited another 10 minutes before a different waitress came.  We did not realize that she was also the bartender.  Placed our order including lemon slices for the water.  Approximately 20 minutes later the food arrived and still no lemon slices.  The waitress/bartender was busy slinging drinks at the bar.  She threw a plastic container to her left; it ended up on the floor if the restaurant.  The problem, this item was being used to mix drinks (it appeared that it was a strawberry mixture that was included drinks for the customers.  The plastic container removed on the floor air at least 30 minutes with staff stepping over and around it.  Ordered the Avo-cobb-o salad.  The salad was good, appeared fresh and the Italian dressing on the side was tasty.  Within one hour of returning home, I was seriously ill!  Stomach cramps, sour taste and the dreadful case of diarrhea.  What a wonderful way to spend a Saturday.  BTW, we even had to wait for our bill.  Red Robin, the most disappointing experience in years.  I think I will skip visiting your restaurant until you take customer service seriously and improve on the customer experience.  This visit is a D minus!

My husband and I drive here regularly from south of Atlanta because I absolutely love their food. However, lately we've stopped coming altogether because the service is SO bad and our order ALWAYS comes out wrong (literally every single time). Every time I order some pink and every time they bring it out cooked with no pink and my side always comes out wrong. The service is SOOOOO slow it ruins everything for me! I worked at Red Robin for over 7 years and find it intolerable to endure such poor service. They're supposed to greet you in 30 seconds which I find laughable. Last time not a single person came to our table in 7 minutes then I had to get up and hunt someone down. I set a timer now because it happens so often and the servers AND MANAGERS basically roll their eyes like I'm lying about how long I've waited. First bite check back? Yeah right. Never happens. Napkins or silverware? Only if you ask and even then most of the time I have to get up and get my own . Drink refills? You might get ONE your entire visit if you're lucky enough to have your server come back by your table before your plate is empty and you're ready to leave. The management is so unconcerned with the sucky service and that bums me out so much. It is clear even THEY don't see the failing service all around them. When management can't even recognize a table is VISIBLY unhappy, there's a serious problem at the root of the restaurant. This really sucks because Red Robin is my favorite restaurant but between the horrendous service, unconcerned management, servers that just don't care and cooks that can't read a ticket, I'll spend my money elsewhere.

Food here is always good and our waitress Crystal was on top of everything which was wonderful. I did order the fried pickle appetizers which where a bit overcooked. Seemed like more breading than pickle but I didn't mention this when she asked how they were.  All and all great experience, I'll definitely be back!

Horrible.  Service is great! But the food was atrocious and completely incorrect. They remade my burger just to make it wrong for a second time!  The manager is even worse. He came by and told me how Red Robin is a Zagat rated restaurant and that their burgers are great but attributed their subpar food to it being lunchtime on a Sunday.... After much more senseless rambling he still charged me for my coke and the extra sauce I ordered. Absolutely ridiculous! He clearly needs a crash course in customer service. Will not be coming back to Red Robin ever again.

Used to work at this location when it first opened - and the FOOD has gone insanely downhill. I don't care how much you blame the "rush" of people coming in vs how many servers were cut for the night. The burgers literally were tasteless and DRENCHED in grease. Almost like they were put in a big bowl of water and grease. My boyfriend lost his appetite and so did I. The burgers were also very undercooked. Manager comped our meals and apologized, and the server blamed the rush of people. No excuse for what we encountered. Probably won't be back for a while. At least to this location. PS new burgers on the menu are now $14+ each! Save your $ and your appetite and go to any other burger joint around.
The burgers are amazing as usual and the customer service is unmatched. Our server Emily was as great a server as one could desire.

Food was good but service was too slow. I went to the bar to grab a beer and a burger and it took forever. Actually, the bartender served another person ahead of me even though I was there before her. I didn't make a big deal of it but thought it was ridiculous that I'd been there for a whole 25 minutes before I even got my order taken. The only thing that kept me quiet was the fact I was on my phone and you know the saying, never piss your food server off. Other than that, this place is convenient for me as I live close by so I'll prolly give it another try

I am mixed on this place.  I got a gourmet burger and it was pretty good.  My wife got the standard Tavern burger and was not pleased.  The fries are okay.  You do get free refills on fries, though. This place is confusing on the brain.  Is this a bar that looks like a kids restaurant or is this a kids restaurant that serves alcohol? They have a full bar with a pretty good selection of alcohol, including draft beer.  However, it does not have a bar feel.  It has a kids place feel especially with a giant cartoon mascot in the middle of the restaurant.    They have a kiosk at each table.  You can use it play games or pay your bill.  The cool thing is that is allows your bill to be easily divided between patrons.  This is a good idea if you are there with a large group of people and you don't want to deal with manually dividing up the bill or having your waitress / waiter do it.

Would not recommend this establishment. I came here in a party of four and the hostess was not even present at her post. It took a long time for us to be seated, which I didn't understand because there were plenty of empty tables. Our food took a long time to arrive too. The ladies bathroom had two broken locks and only one stall had toilet paper. The food was incredibly greasy and I would not come again.
Burger ordered medium , was very well done. Draft beer not cold enough and almost flat. Fries barely room temperature. I won't be back.

I used to like this restaurant, but it has gone downhill lately. They now have tablets at the table so you can have the honor of inputting your rewards card yourself.  You can also pay $3.99 to play games on it or listen to your kids whine and beg about it. The fee is in small text so you can miss seeing that.  When you are ready to order, you push a button on the tablet. It's becoming just a more expensive Sonic except the customer service has been better at Sonic. Our server treated us as if she thought we were annoying. Maybe she was just having a bad day. I don't expect a faux Disney cheerfulness, but customers shouldn't be treated as an interruption to the job - The business exists because of the customers.

I am a fan because of the selection that you get in burgers and alcoholic beverages. The menu give a lot of burgers to chose from and my hubby and I enjoy the atmosphere, not to mention the bottomless fries. My burger I prefer to be medium well and I have been to this location five times and the temp of the burgers has always been spot on. My hubby likes his well done and he says the burger is well done without being dry, so he is a fan as well. Also, the drinks are nice and you have a great variety to choose from.

Don't waste your time! This is by far the worst restaurant experience my family and I have had in a long time. First, the restaurant booths and tables are very dirty! There is ketchup smeared and splattered on the walls by the booths. Even our menus had sauces smashed on them. We should've trusted our first instincts and left. We were seated at 11:54 AM and placed our order immediately. When 12:30 came all other customers, including customers who came in after us, had been served and were eating. We decided to leave. At the front, as we were leaving, we asked the hostess to locate the manager for us so we could explain the situation, in an effort to call it to management's attention. He approached us with an "uh huh", not a hello, good afternoon or anything. Very unprofessional! As I explained to him why we were leaving he just stood there. We have eaten at Red Robin across the country and never had such poor service or seen a restaurant so poorly kept up. They receive one star for bringing out our drinks, that is not saying much for a sit down restaurant.

My wife and I always make a trip to this location's Red Robin around her birthday.  Place is great for families. Very casual for a fair price due to bottomless fries (all you can eat fries). Their burgers are very good. Many varieties of them to choose from.

Was there from 6-10pm one night. I was catching up and chatting with a friend. They were just okay about checking in initially and our orders were right. The food was decent but I used the tablet when I was ready to pay to call the server to pay cash and put the rest on my debit card so that I could tip. Needless to say, I got up and tried to pay someone else but everyone was too busy. It was busy but how can you not take a payment? I had just enough to pay the bill with no tip. After 30 minutes of the call attendant button blinking and turning red after awhile, I put $43 down on my $42.70 bill and walked out. Wrapped up my burger in the paper it came in and asked for a manager and a Togo container. My water and drink glass were both empty for entirely too long. We could have walked out without paying and they would have been the wiser. Needless to say, the manager went to the table, grabbed my cash, gave it back to me, comped the meals and only charged me for the drinks. I didn't mind paying for the meal or tipping, but there was an epic fail in customer service that night. I was pretty disappointed in RR and will not be going back anytime soon.

My 3rd visit but 1st review; this place has good food; but my wife endless fries took FOREVER to be refilled and our server was so overwhelmed with tables we had to wave her down for our endless refills for our drinks. So, expect a wait when you first walk in but all and all, the polite, somewhat attentive servers make-up for it.
Burger was over cooked, and over priced. There are much better places to get a burger such as local republic for this price

Not a fan. It took way too long to get a mediocre burger. Nothing about this place made me want to go back. Endless fries are a great concept but they serve them in such small portions and take so long to bring you more that they might as well be quite limited. Never got my second round because I didn't have 2 hours for lunch. My burger, coke, and 8 French fries came to about $15 before tip and almost made me late to work.

I went to Red Robin with my mom two months ago and the experience was just okay. The food was great, but the atmosphere was more for families. My waitress barely came to the table to check on us. I was looking forward to the endless garlic fries but that definitely didn't happen.  Let me back track to the food. I ordered the Southern Charm burger with garlic fries and a virgin freckled lemonade. The burger was alright, but I really just ate the patty. The lemonade and fries were delicious. Overall, I probably won't come back anytime soon but that's because I don't have kids in tow. And Ted's is in the same shopping center. Read more:

So I came here a couple of times since my last review and my first experience here was not reflective of my average experience here. Since my first review, the staff here is always been wonderful. I also learned they have a lot of different options for every situation that you need. I was doing a diet called Whole 30 once, I was able to get a burger with a lettuce bun with no dairy or gluten. I tried a vegetarian diet, and I was able to get a veggie burger. I was doing no diet and I was able to get an amazing burning love burger which is one of my favorites. I've also tried their milkshakes and some of their appetizers and they're all really good. With your burger, you're able to substitute bottomless fries for bottomless salad or broccoli too. Their broccoli is actually really amazing and healthy. They have a ton of deals every week too if you sign up to their royalty rewards program. I took my picky eater dad here today and even he was impressed.  Oh and if you play Pokemon Go, there are two pokestops here.

I haven't been toa Red Robin in about 4 years; this was not a good reunion. The burgers are smaller, the fries are over cooked, and they are way over priced for the product you get. How do you mess up fried zucchini??? Just an overall bad experience, we won't be coming back.

I have been here once before and everything was fine, but yesterday proved to be different. We went out with several friends, had burgers all around. Out of the nine in our group, three got sick over the course of the night. I am not sure if it was bad meat, but I am hesitant to return to this location again.
worse service! we waited 15 minutes without anyone coming to greet us or take our drink order.  people were seated after us and immediately were being served.  Don't recommend this place.

Visited location on Saturday, January 14 for birthday dinner.  We had 13 in our party.  Restaurant was busy and we had one waittress for a large party.  She was not able to handle a large table so therfore service was not good at all.  She did no refill our drinks or check on during meal when we need refills on endless fries and brocolli.  i emailed copoate office and gave them the specific details on the server and service.  The bathroom door in ladies room would not shut either.  This was such a disapointmenet for our family for a birthday dinner.  Food was ok not great.

I have to say Red Robin in very consistent at being less than mediocre! We had our first experience in the Orlando area a few years ago and the food was tasteless and the service less than attentive. Well, fast forward to today, a completely different location in a different state and save experience. Started off with a 5 minute wait at the hostess stand for someone....anyone to come seat us. We get seated at the front door at a booth made for preschoolers, request another table, get seated again at another table. Our waiter comes, basically pressures to order, order is placed, food arrives and here we go again. My guacamole and bacon burger has almost no guacamole on it, my sweet potato fries are burned beyond recognition, my daughter has 3 fries on her plate and neither of our burgers are medium as requested. Oh, and my son's salted caramel shake is a vanilla mess with caramel drizzled on top. Needless to say, I'm never going back to any Red Robin any where! Btw....these were free birthday burgers so we spent a total of $7 and yet I still feel like I was robbed!!! Do yourself a favor and go a mile down the road to Steak and Shake.

We live up the street from this restaurant but always forget about it as it is tucked up away in the shoppes at Webb gin. Also, food, service, staff is always mediocre so it's easy to forget about this place. You can normally get seated ans waited on right away. No complaints, it's just an average place.

Used to enjoy going here with family. I don't know what has happened to them but it is truly sad. Only went here tonight because my grand children wanted Togo there for a promised treat. They are just children and they were disappointed! To quote " we wasted our treat" They said " next time grandma you pick the place!

I never leave reviews on yelp but tonight I felt like I needed to. Came here to eat with my boyfriend for dinner. The hostess sat us down and it took about 10 minutes for our server to bring us our drinks. Took forever waiting to order, she hardly even said a word to us the whole night until the end. Ordered at about 8:59/9:00 and the food didn't get to our table for roughly 30 minutes. Once the food was brought out (not even by our server), both of our burgers were room temperature. Only thing remotely warm was the fries. My boyfriend asked for the manager. He offered to recook our burger but we both didn't want to wait another 30 minutes for cold food. Didn't offer to discount, comp or anything to make our experience a little better. Never got any refills. I asked for a box for my burger I hardly even touched and never received said box. Ended up leaving my burger hardly touched.  Highly disappointed, even after all my friends were telling me to try it out. Tonight was my first time - never going back again.

This is the worse experience I've had at red robin. Came with my family and my baby order a cheese pizza, it came out burnt.
