After spending it back, it came out burnt again and was told this is the best it'll be. How in the world do you burn cheese pizza and then bring it to the table for someone to eat, and then say this is the best it will be. Well, they bring it out the third time...cold!! Why, just why. I ordered the crispy chicken sandwich, that was the toughest piece of chicken. My bf ordered the Banzai salad, had to ask several times for more salad dressing and the bread that comes with the meal. I'm really about to make this my last visit to red robin bc this is ridiculous...

Overall the experience was ok. Upon arrival it took long to get a seat even when the restaurant was not busy.  No one was waiting and there were plenty tables empty. Food was good. Requested a dessert, "Gooey Chocolate Brownie cake", took really long to serve it.  It was delivered first to the incorrect table; then brought to our table.  Ice cream was melted and the person that brought it (not the server) gave us forks to eat it. The server apologized and tried to compensate with another dessert.  That was kind of her, but we were not ready for a second dessert.  They still charged us for the melted one though!

This place has really gone down over the years.  When it first opened over 8 years ago it was a shining star in the community.  We could hardly believe our luck that it was only 10 minutes away.  Gourmet burgers with bottomless steak fries...awesome. Now with so many more options in the area, declining food quality and service, RR is not a first choice.   The ambience is still bright and cheery, very family friendly.  And the restaurant is full of fun eclectic art pieces.  They've changed the furniture (tables, booths, chairs) about a year ago including high back red leather chairs in the main dining area. The floor felt a little less greasy this time but the bathroom was still not up to par.  One of the faucets was continually running, paper on the floor, no toilet paper in one stall and one stall door literally bangs into the toilet when opened.  The food was pretty good, including the nachos with chili con queso.  The burgers, Royal/$11.09 and Gourmet Cheeseburger/$9.69, had great flavor.   The egg on the Royal was over easy and not medium as ordered and the bun fell apart;  but delicious all the same.  The fries were a little over cooked and the initial batch was lukewarm.  But the subsequent batches were piping hot.   The service was actually better than normal.  The waitress was pleasant and attentive and the food came out quicker than I can ever remember.   Possibly because we sat in the bar area.   There was an error on the bill but she had the manager fix it in about 5 minutes.  It was an ok visit but not somewhere I would recommend any longer.

Dropped by tonight around 9 pm.  We were told there was a 10 minute wait but I saw lots of empty tables and very few wait staff.  Looked at the dismal ratings and decided to head to Steak and Shake.  Sad.  I really liked this place before.

I was looking forward to eating at Red Robin. I was disappointed.  The service was not good. Took forever for someone to ask if we had given a drink order. I ordered the garden burger. What I got was a slimy half cooked something which was somewhat disgusting. The menu did not describe this as a vegetarian patty, which I think is what I got. I have had excellent veggie burgers and would have been ok with it but this did not even resemble that. The waitress asked what side we wanted. I asked what sides come with it.  She listed several choices but never said the sides were not included with the entree. No one offered to refill my water. That said, the patty melt was good as well as the kids chicken. Very expensive for what we had. That was my one and only visit to Red Robin. So disappointed.

My family went here last week for dinner. We were seated quickly and received our menus. The waitress didn't come to our table for 10 mins. By this time we already knew our orders and did just that. After ordering our drinks were brought out in a timely manner. The waitress was average friendly. We all had different burgers and the good was tasty. The waitress immediately knew I had the wrong side dish and explained this before she set my food on the table, as well as brought me out the correct side also in a very timely manner. Our drinks we refilled as normal and we all got french fry refills.  We realized they had the "call waitress " button at the table and used it, she can quickly.  Aside from our intial wait, everything was good and done well.  Would come here again.

Pros:free burger and fries on your birthday(if you sign up), yummy unlimited fries with their honey mustard sauce. Cons: always a long wait, takes a while to get refills on the fries, very noisy/loud, and I wouldn't rate the hamburgers on being good, I always get the chicken.

THE WORST burger restaurant ever, in fact it is one of the worst American style restaurant I had ever eaten at. I ordered 2 grilled Mexican style chicken with garlic herb fries and my family ordered hamburgers with regular fries. the chicken was so chewy and super salty like it had been in marinate for very long time and frozen years ago. I know this because the texture of the chicken had changed, it was super disgusting. the garlic herb fries were drenched in flood of oil and tasteless, same with the burgers. I also ordered smoothie, it was nasty like they just put the whole bag of sugar in it. I only drank couple sips. The service was super slow, it took forever for her to come by to ask for our drinks and to deliver our drink so forget about asking for more bottomless fries because you will be sitting there for 3 or 4 hours. whenever I heard their theme song Red Robin yum, it should be Red Robin YUCK!!. There are so many restaurants that did not survive the economy like Ruby Tuesday, Red lobster etc and this one will be on the same fate because they are not willing to improve but keep providing disgusting food and horrible customer service. It starts with management! if you are the owner of this restaurant, you need to fire the management and start new or you probably had already thinking about closing this business. Red Robin does not even deserve 1 star! I had to put one because I must submit this review. Customers need to stay away from this awful restaurant, believe me the reviews are correct. If you see mixed reviews, the good ones are probably fake. I am a regular Yelp reviewers, I don't give bad reviews unless it is very necessary.

So I used my birthday coupon and you get a free burger entree. I sat at the bar and everyone from the hostess to the bartender were friendly. The only reason why I didn't give four stars is no one informed me that they were out of steak fries until the server brought my meal and I saw crinkles fries. I asked why no steak fries and he said has been out for three days. I wish I would have known that but good thing is the bartender didn't charge me for upgrading to Parmesan fries.

My family and I went to Red Robin for dinner this past weekend. I tasted some of the other burgers at the table. Some were good and mine was sub par. The fries were cold and the service was ok. Cute spot to take the kids. I don't have a desire to visit again.

Disappointed in the customer service I received. My family and I visited this store several time. My youngest son who is 7 years old ask to go on his birthday so they could sing happy birthday to him. After he heard them sing it to some one on a previous visit.  I let the server know as soon as we placed our order. After we finished our meal and waited awhile for the to bring his birthday sundae the server told me they were to busy and couldn't make the time to do it. It only take 10 second to sing a birthday song. And mind you it was a Wednesday night I been there on Saturdays and they witness them sing the song to several parties. After I voiced my displeasure I was told they found try and get some people together. I declined and left the store because as a customer I don't think any one would have mind waiting 10 second extra while a few waitress sang a birthday song to a 7 year old child. And if you were to busy they what changed?

Inside for almost an hour, everything was going fine until our orders came out and they were wrong. The second time our orders came back mine was still wrong and my girlfriend took a bite of her burger and her bacon was burnt to he'll. Spoke with manager and he apologize for the issue but we still paid for our appetizer and drinks. Won't be returning

Have not been to red robin in many years but wanted to revisit tonight. Almost did not go because of many reviews talking about bad wait times for tables, food, and drink. Also negatives on the wait staff. But i went anyway, at about 6pm sat night. It was just starting to get pretty crowded. It only took 5 minutes for a table for 2. We were helped right away by a busy but friendly waitress. It took about 5 minutes for drinks and less than 15 mins for our food. I saw negative reviews on bottomless fries but we got plenty and waitress stopped to see  if we needed more several times. Service was great! My problem was that the burgers just werent that tasty, just kinda bland. I got the sur acha and the mac and cheese burgers, buns didnt seem very fresh and not the flavor i would have expected from menu description.  Overall, still a reasonable burger bar. Finally - please clean the bathrooms, very messy!!!

These are a very generous two stars... Not sure why, but this whole entire area has horrible service. To Go is the way "to go" here. Service is more Miss than hit. How can you have bottomless fries, if your sever never checks on you? ‍ The place could be cleaner too. I've been to locations on the west coast and can say that this one will disappoint.

This place is hit or miss. Usually great food great people but tonight it took 1 hour to get our food.  But nice to be with family.  Great wait staff but kitchen is always behind.  Don't come here for a quick bite.

Going here for the first time was like watching an episode of Bar Rescue. If you want first hand experience what a restaurant is like when it is being poorly managed and has staff that hate their job,then go here. You will often run into a restaurant that has poor waiters but this place took it to a whole other level. All the wait staff walking around like they don't know who has what table and groups of guests being left outside unattended. There is one bartender trying to make drinks for the entire restaurant, get togo orders ready and help give direction to the wait staff. She did an excellent job with what is being given to her. She often had to go get things from the kitchen and bring it to tables because the waitresses are nowhere to be found. The bad communication between all the staff is just a complete joke. The manager was also just walking around watching things but doing nothing. I would be incredibly concerned if I owed this restaurant. The food was just okay and might be better on a day that is very, very slow. We sat at the bar and she apologized a few times for the things we were witnessing. When we got up to leave, a different lady was behind the bar finally trying to help the bartender and I smiled at her and she just looked at me with a nasty look. I am glad we sat at the bar, otherwise I am sure we wouldn't have made it to get our food. Hopefully the owner will come and witness this catastrophe before it's too late.

Service was absolutely horrible at this location. We walked in and the women who appeared to be the manager was just yelling to get us a table and had a bad attitude. Then we waited for nearly 15 minutes for our waitress to come to our table..mind you they were not busy. It took another 15 for out drinks to get there. Food came out after another long wait and we asked for sauces and our waitress said okay then proceeded to walk away and sit down to count her tips and talk with the hostess instead of getting the sauce. By the time she came back (with no sauce) we had to ask for more fries because ours had gotten cold...all around just bad customer service. The location I nearly go to has never had bad service or given me anything less than great service. I have a feeling this one location is just very poorly run.

Absolutely awful.  The waitress was beyond rude, we left without ordering.  The manager heard us tell the greeter that we were leaving and came out to apologize.  He seemed nice enough, but didn't really try to make up for his employees attitude problem.  We left and went to another restaurant and enjoyed the rest of our evening.

Red Robin yummmmmmm!!! Try getting that tune out of your head. A burger joint at its core, Red Robins delivers the goods. I have only come to this location on weekdays during lunch, so I cant attest to wait times as there really hasn't been any when I come.  The decor is clean inside. Your greeted by the Lady Liberty holding up a burger instead of a torch. You would think with the name of the place they would have a cartoon bird holding up the burger, but hey, lets get some American spirit in here and display the statue of liberty advertising sodium and cholesterol. Some odd pictures on the walls that I am guessing were bought on eBay or an antique shop. Gotta dig the beer bottle chandelier in the bar area though. Burgers are really good. Its not the meat so to speak, but the seasoning they use ( you can buy this stuff by the way ). The prices are kind of all over the place, but if you order the Tavern Burgers, its $6.99 for a really good burger and unlimited fries ( fries are good as well ). They do have some unusual burgers such as a Taco Burger...guess the chef was high one day and wanted a burger and Mexican, but had to use what he had in the immediate area so threw chips and guacamole on a burger.  The place is frequented by elderly people whenever my wife and I come. I guess the early bird special here rocks. Staff seems friendly and you get your food quickly ( again this is when I come ). It gets the bada-bing thumbs up from the Local Guy.

This is probably one of my favorite burger chains. The   specials are rotated on a regular bases and food is consistently good. The parking is a little small right next to the building but plenty of parking in near by. Time to be seated was minimal. The sever was very attentive. The food was prepared exactly as ordered. Good location to get a quick meal.

Very disappointed. The hostess staff seem to think it appropriate to ignore the customers in favor of staring at the iPad used for seating charts. When they do finally decide to notice you they will walk away in the middle of your sentence to look for a table that apparently does show up on the all knowing iPad.  My burger was good and as expected on the other hand there were very few fries. My daughter had the pub mac and cheese. Size was not what was expected for the price.  My wife ordered the $7.00  chips and salsa. She referred to it as tomato juice and onions. Came in a very small contained more like a condiment size. The service was fair and we had no problem with the waiter. On the whole won't return quality did not match cost.
